content: Thank you for collecting your thoughts here, Jessie! Lyft, with its redesign, looks a lot now like Uber, and I don’t mean that in a negative light. Features like time and route to pick up, fare estimates, driver and car details are ever so important in this space. For urbanites, I still wonder as a product guy: what if users are able to alter their pickup location once they see the route to pick up? If I know that the corner of 34th and 9th is jammed, and the cops seem to be diverting traffic a certain way, wouldn’t it be great if I can let my driver know to pick me up at the corner of 35th and 8th instead? And … wouldn’t a feature like this be acting on user feedback in close to realtime? :) I can’t wait to see what Lyft or Uber can develop in this space. Even better if they can propose a better pick up location based on traffic data from one of the maps providers.
